intro: Pleurothallis breviscapa, commonly known as the short-stemmed pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments within the undergrowth of forests. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure and compact size. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
